solution_line_template: If it takes on average {old_average_time} minutes to get dressed, then it takes {total_time_old_method} minutes total on the school week because {school_days_in_week} x {old_average_time} = <<{school_days_in_week}*{old_average_time}={total_time_old_method}>>{total_time_old_method}

Thus far this week it has taken him {current_week_total_time} minutes to get dressed because {monday_time} + {tuesday_time} + {wednesday_time} + {thursday_time} = <<{monday_time}+{tuesday_time}+{wednesday_time}+{thursday_time}={current_week_total_time}>>{current_week_total_time}

To tie his previous method, he needs to take {friday_time_needed} minutes on Friday because {total_time_old_method} - {current_week_total_time} = <<{total_time_old_method}-{current_week_total_time}={friday_time_needed}>>{friday_time_needed}
